intro: Anthoxanthum mexicanum, commonly known as Mexican false brome, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, typically with a bluish-green hue. Anthoxanthum mexicanum is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
